001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder;
002
003import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
004import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty;
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty.Property;
006
007/**
008 * Builder to create {@link io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder }.
009 * Creates GELF Encoder.
010 * <table class="table">
011 * <caption><strong>Properties retrieved from LogProperties</strong></caption>
012 * <tr>
013 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
014 * <th>Type</th>
015 * <th>Required</th>
016 * <th>Default</th>
017 * <th>Description</th>
018 * </tr>
019 * <tr>
020 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_host }</code></td>
021 * <td><code>String</code></td>
022 * <td><code>true</code></td>
023 * <td><code>null</code></td>
024 * <td>Host field in GELF.</td>
025 * </tr>
026 * <tr>
027 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_headers }</code></td>
028 * <td><code>String (converted)</code></td>
029 * <td><code>false</code></td>
030 * <td><code>null</code></td>
031 * <td>Additional headers that will be prefix with "_".</td>
032 * </tr>
033 * <tr>
034 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_prettyPrint }</code></td>
035 * <td><code>Boolean</code></td>
036 * <td><code>false</code></td>
037 * <td><code>null</code></td>
038 * <td><code>true</code> will pretty print the JSON, default is false.</td>
039 * </tr>
040 * </table>
041 */
042public final class GelfEncoderBuilder implements io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogBuilder<GelfEncoderBuilder,io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder> {
043
044        /**
045         * The properties to be retrieved from config will have
046         * this prefix.
047         */
048        static final String PROPERTY_PREFIX = "logging.encoder.{name}.";
049        
050        /**
051         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_host } = java.lang.String</code> Host field in GELF.
052         */
053        static final String PROPERTY_host = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "host";
054        /**
055         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_headers } = java.util.Map</code> Additional headers that will be prefix with "_".
056         */
057        static final String PROPERTY_headers = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "headers";
058        /**
059         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_prettyPrint } = java.lang.Boolean</code> <code>true</code> will pretty print the JSON, default is false.
060         */
061        static final String PROPERTY_prettyPrint = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "prettyPrint";
062        
063        private final String propertyPrefix;
064        final Property<java.lang.String> property_host;
065        final Property<java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>> property_headers;
066        final Property<java.lang.Boolean> property_prettyPrint;
067        
068        private final java.lang.String name;
069        private java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable String host = null;
070        private java.util.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String> headers = null;
071        private java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean prettyPrint = null;
072        
073        /**
074         * Create a builder for {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder }.
075         * @param name will fill <code>{name}</code> in <code>logging.encoder.{name}.</code>. Property name prefix.
076         */
077        public GelfEncoderBuilder(
078                        java.lang.String name
079                        ) {
080                java.util.Map<String,String> prefixParameters = java.util.Map.of(
081                                "name", name
082                        );
083                this.propertyPrefix = LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_PREFIX, prefixParameters);
084                this.name = name;
085                property_host = Property.builder()
086                                                .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_host, prefixParameters));
087
088                property_headers = Property.builder()
089                        .map(_v -> io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder.convertHeaders(_v))
090                        .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_headers, prefixParameters));
091
092                property_prettyPrint = Property.builder()
093                        .ofBoolean()
094                        .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_prettyPrint, prefixParameters));
095
096        }
097
098
099        
100        /**
101         * Sets <strong>required</strong> host.
102         * Host field in GELF.
103         * Default is <code>null</code>.
104         * @param host <code>{@value #PROPERTY_host } = java.lang.String</code> Host field in GELF.
105         * @return this builder.
106         */
107        public GelfEncoderBuilder host(java.lang.String host) {
108                this.host = host;
109                return this;
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Sets headers.
114         * Additional headers that will be prefix with "_".
115         * Default is <code>null</code>.
116         * @param headers <code>{@value #PROPERTY_headers } = java.util.Map</code> Additional headers that will be prefix with "_".
117         * @return this builder.
118         */
119        public GelfEncoderBuilder headers(java.util.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String> headers) {
120                this.headers = headers;
121                return this;
122        }
123        
124        /**
125         * Sets prettyPrint.
126         * <code>true</code> will pretty print the JSON, default is false.
127         * Default is <code>null</code>.
128         * @param prettyPrint <code>{@value #PROPERTY_prettyPrint } = java.lang.Boolean</code> <code>true</code> will pretty print the JSON, default is false.
129         * @return this builder.
130         */
131        public GelfEncoderBuilder prettyPrint(java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean prettyPrint) {
132                this.prettyPrint = prettyPrint;
133                return this;
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Creates {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder } from this builder.
138         * @return {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder }.
139         */
140        public io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder build() {
141                return io.jstach.rainbowgum.json.encoder.GelfEncoder.of(
142                                this.name
143                                , property_host.require(this.host)
144                                , this.headers
145                                , this.prettyPrint
146                                );
147        }
148        
149        @Override
150        public GelfEncoderBuilder fromProperties(LogProperties properties) {
151                var __v = LogProperty.Validator.of(this.getClass());
152                var _host = property_host.get(properties).or(this.host);
153                __v.add(_host);
154                var _headers = property_headers.get(properties).or(this.headers);
155                __v.addIfError(_headers);
156                var _prettyPrint = property_prettyPrint.get(properties).or(this.prettyPrint);
157                __v.addIfError(_prettyPrint);
158                __v.validate();
159                this.host = _host.value();
160                this.headers = _headers.valueOrNull();
161                this.prettyPrint = _prettyPrint.valueOrNull();
162                return this;
163        }
164        
165        /**
166         * Turns the builder into java.util.Properties like Map skipping values that are null.
167         * @param consumer apply is called where first arg is key and second is value.
168         */
169        public void toProperties(java.util.function.BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
170                var _host = this.host;
171                if (_host != null) {
172                        consumer.accept(property_host.key(), property_host.propertyString(_host));
173                }
174                var _headers = this.headers;
175                if (_headers != null) {
176                        consumer.accept(property_headers.key(), property_headers.propertyString(_headers));
177                }
178                var _prettyPrint = this.prettyPrint;
179                if (_prettyPrint != null) {
180                        consumer.accept(property_prettyPrint.key(), property_prettyPrint.propertyString(_prettyPrint));
181                }
182        }
183        
184        /**
185         * The interpolated property prefix: {@value #PROPERTY_PREFIX}.
186         * @return resolved prefix which should end with a "<code>.</code>".
187         */
188        @Override
189        public String propertyPrefix() {
190                return this.propertyPrefix;
191        }
192        
193}
